title: [bug] create_new_raster_from_base (utils/geoutils.py): bug if output array is singleband
body:
create_new_raster_from_base fails in this situation:
```python
extract_archive(src="tests/data/spacenet.zip")
data = read_csv("tests/tiling/tiling_segmentation_binary-multiband_ci.csv")
ref_raster = Path(data[0]['tif'])
out_raster = ref_raster.parent / f"{ref_raster.stem}_copy.tif"
out_array = rasterio.open(ref_raster).read(1)  # read only one band
create_new_raster_from_base(input_raster=ref_raster, output_raster=out_raster, write_array=out_array)
```

Stack trace:
```
tests\utils\test_geoutils.py:37 (TestGeoutils.test_create_new_raster_from_base[bands_request0])
self = <test_geoutils.TestGeoutils object at 0x00000200FE481480>
bands_request = [1]

    def test_create_new_raster_from_base(self, bands_request) -> None:
        """Tests the 'create_new_raster_from_base' geo-utility"""
        extract_archive(src="tests/data/spacenet.zip")
        data = read_csv("tests/tiling/tiling_segmentation_binary-multiband_ci.csv")
        ref_raster = Path(data[0]['tif'])
        out_raster = ref_raster.parent / f"{ref_raster.stem}_copy.tif"
        out_array = rasterio.open(ref_raster).read(bands_request)
>       create_new_raster_from_base(input_raster=ref_raster, output_raster=out_raster, write_array=out_array)

tests\utils\test_geoutils.py:45: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
utils\geoutils.py:56: in create_new_raster_from_base
    dst.write(write_array[:, :], 1)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

>   ???
E   ValueError: Source shape (1, 1, 426, 413) is inconsistent with given indexes 1

rasterio\_io.pyx:1695: ValueError
```

It seems the solution would simply be to remove the [if statement at end of function](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/blob/develop/utils/geoutils.py#L55):
```python
        if count == 1:
            dst.write(write_array[:, :], 1)
        else:
            dst.write(write_array)
```
would become
```python
        dst.write(write_array)
```
